Work and Volunteer Experience

Software Developer at SageData, June - September 2011

Software company specializing in asset management through barcoding and RFID.

  • Developed automated tests and did manual testing for new software
  • Designed and implemented a security patrol tracking system with a small team. Created versions to target desktops, mobile devices, and the web
  • Tools/Frameworks used: Visual C#, ASP.NET, HTML, CSS, MSSQL, PostgreSQL, Mercurial

Instructor at Virtual Ventures Summer Camp, Summer of 2010

Summer camp focusing on developing interest in technology and engineering

  • Created lesson plans in the areas of computer science, web design, and information security for campers aged 10-15
  • Taught groups of campers how to create websites with HTML and CSS, over SSH and SCP
  • Created a video player system in PHP and MySQL to serve videos to campers every morning and afternoon
  • Refactored and redesigned an existing camper lesson choice selection system
  • Tools/Frameworks used: PHP, HTML, CSS, MySQL, bash

Volunteer at Virtual Ventures Summer Camp, Summers of 2008-2009

Summer camp focusing on developing interest in technology and engineering

  • Aided instructors in teaching lessons by helping struggling campers understand concepts and catch up
  • Assisted campers with problems in their projects
  • Designed more challenging projects for ambitious campers

Volunteer at iSisters Technology Mentoring, July - August 2007

Canadian charity that connects women in need with technology through mentoring.

  • Helped attendees learn various simple tasks on the computer (e.g. add a table to a Word document)
  • Set up a new computer lab at the Cornerstone Women's Shelter
